# Present Experience

AI Solutions Architect for Legal Tech - Freelance - present

I built an app for lawyers to process jurisprudence faster by leveraging open-source LLMs, RAG retrievals, vector databases, an agentic workflow with LangChain, HuggingFace resources for deployment, and Google Cloud Functions for automation. I used the latest academic paper for better vector retrievals by employing re-ranking and also performed graph theory on embeddings for better context from legal documents. I also used a quantized model to allow for faster inference and avoid relying on APIs.

Tech Stack:

Open-source LLMs (Large Language Models):

- GGUF for using quantized models to allow for smaller-sized models
- HuggingFace Transformers

RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) Retrievals:

- Retrieval-Augmented Generation techniques for improved search and response accuracy.

Using re-ranking and graph theory on embeddings to enhance understanding of context from legal documents.

Vector Databases:

- FAISS (Facebook AI Similarity Search)

Agentic Workflow: LangGraph

# Antoine Bertin's Work


# Project with Ubisoft

Antoine Bertin conducted a comprehensive analysis of the games available on Steam's marketplace as part of a project for Ubisoft. The goal was to gain insights into the video game ecosystem and current trends, ultimately aiming to understand the factors influencing a game's popularity or sales globally.

Key aspects of the analysis included:

- Distribution of games by publishers
- Ratings of games
- Trends in release years including the impact of events like Covid-19
- Pricing strategies
- Language representation
- Age restrictions

For genre analysis, Antoine explored the most prevalent genres, their review ratios, publishers' genre preferences, and the most lucrative genres. Additionally, platform preferences were examined to determine if certain genres were more likely to be found on specific platforms.

Tools used for this project:

- Databricks
- PySpark

# Skills

Antoine Bertin's skills include:

- Big Data
- Machine Learning

# Project with AT&T

Antoine Bertin worked on a project with AT&T to develop a spam detector solely based on SMS content. The aim was to address the issue of spam messages and protect users' experience.

Key points of the project:

- Starting simple to develop effective models
- Utilizing transfer learning due to limited dataset

Deliverables for this project included:

- A notebook containing preprocessing steps and the training of deep learning models
- Clear documentation of the model's performance

For more details, refer to Antoine Bertin's GitHub repository.

# Antoine Bertin - Work Overview


# Machine Learning Project - Walmart Marketing Service

Antoine Bertin spearheaded a project for Walmart's marketing service, focusing on constructing a robust machine-learning model for estimating weekly sales accurately. The project aimed to understand the relationship between sales and economic indicators to formulate informed marketing strategies.

# Project Phases:

1. Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) and Preprocessing: Extensive data analysis and preprocessing were conducted to prepare the dataset for machine learning. This involved visualizations, statistical computations, handling missing values, feature engineering, and outlier treatment.
2. Linear Regression Model Training: A baseline linear regression model was trained and evaluated for performance on training and test sets. Analysis of model coefficients provided insights into sales predictions.
3. Regularized Regression Models: To address overfitting, regularized regression models (Ridge and Lasso) were utilized. Fine-tuning of regularization strength using GridSearchCV optimized model performance.

# Skills Utilized:

- Supervised Machine Learning (Regression task) - Weekly sales prediction
- Unsupervised ML (DBSCAN + Truncated SVD) - Recommender system & Topic Extraction

# Machine Learning Skills and Projects

Antoine Bertin demonstrated proficiency in machine learning through various projects and skills:

- Supervised Machine Learning: Weekly sales prediction project associated with Jedha Bootcamp.
- Unsupervised Machine Learning: Deploying a recommender system and Topic Extraction using DBSCAN and Truncated SVD, also associated with Jedha Bootcamp.

# Project Approach:

Antoine Bertin's approach involved conducting thorough EDA, feature engineering, algorithm selection, hyperparameter tuning, prediction, submission, analysis of model parameters, and offering actionable recommendations for improving conversion rates.

Find Antoine Bertin's code on GitHub for further reference.

# Antoine Bertin - Work Overview


Antoine Bertin worked on various projects utilizing unsupervised machine learning techniques to enhance online sales and optimize user experience. One of his notable projects was for The North Face ecommerce platform.

# The North Face Ecommerce Project

For The North Face ecommerce project, Antoine Bertin focused on implementing two major solutions to boost conversion rates:

1. Deployed a recommender system to suggest additional products to users based on their interests, enhancing the user experience.
2. Improved the structure of the product catalog by employing topic extraction techniques to challenge existing categorizations and enhance website navigation.

Antoine Bertin broke down the project into three main steps:

1. Identified groups of products with similar descriptions through preprocessing textual data, encoding texts with TF-IDF transformation, and training a clustering model using DBSCAN on the TF-IDF matrix.
2. Developed a recommender system utilizing cluster IDs obtained from the clustering model to suggest similar items to users based on their interests.
3. Delved into topic modeling using an LSA model to automatically extract latent topics from product descriptions, gaining insights through wordcloud analysis.

The project aimed to optimize the online shopping experience for The North Face customers, potentially increasing conversion rates and overall sales on the company's website.

# Uber Pickup Optimization Project

Antoine Bertin also led a project at Uber focused on optimizing pickup locations through unsupervised machine-learning techniques:

- Developed algorithms to identify hot-zones in major cities using clustering techniques like KMeans and DBScan.
- Utilized Uber's trip data to group pickup locations into clusters, pinpointing areas of high demand at various times of the day.
- Visualized hot-zones on interactive maps using Python libraries like Plotly to guide driver positioning for optimal service.

# Skills

Machine Learning, Cluster Analysis, Unsupervised ML (KMeans vs DBSCAN), Hot zone clustering for taxi pick up

# Affiliation

Associated with Jedha Bootcamp

Find more about Antoine Bertin's work on his GitHub.

# Antoine Bertin

# About Antoine Bertin

Antoine Bertin led a project at Uber focused on optimizing pickup locations through unsupervised machine-learning techniques. The project aimed to address the inconvenience users faced when drivers weren't readily available, leading to longer wait times or ride cancellations. By developing algorithms to identify hot-zones in major cities, starting with New York City, Antoine and his team utilized clustering techniques like KMeans and DBScan to group pickup locations into clusters, pinpointing areas of high demand at various times of the day. They visualized these hot-zones on interactive maps using Python libraries like Plotly, offering a clear understanding of optimal driver positioning for better service.

# Skills:

- Machine Learning
- Cluster Analysis

# Antoine Bertin's Story

Antoine Bertin is a young entrepreneur with a diverse background. He earned his sommelier title in Aspen, Colorado, while managing a restaurant business in Paris. Antoine's journey also includes a deep dive into AI and entrepreneurship, leading him to pursue a Master’s degree in Artificial Intelligence at Jedha School. He has expertise in machine learning, tools like Databricks and PySpark, and specialization in predictive modeling and cluster analysis. Antoine's career highlights include working as an AI Consultant and Product Owner for CloprNFT, where he merged blockchain technology with AI to develop a platform combining Hollywood storytelling with NFT technology. Currently, as a Practice Tutor at Jedha Bootcamp, Antoine mentors aspiring data scientists, sharing his expertise and guiding them through the complexities of AI and machine learning.

To manage multiple projects effectively, Antoine Bertin focused on time management and reliability. By dividing the day into focused blocks of time, dedicating mornings to restaurant operations and afternoons to tech business tasks, Antoine ensured clear communication and regular check-ins with teams.
